planets.name: Mercury
planets.information: Mercury is the closest planet to the Sun and the smallest planet in the Solar System. It has a rocky surface and no atmosphere.

planets.name: Venus
planets.information: Venus is the second planet from the Sun and is known for its thick atmosphere, making it the hottest planet in our Solar System.

planets.name: Earth
planets.information: Earth is the third planet from the Sun and the only known celestial body to support life. It has a diverse range of ecosystems and is the home of human beings.

planets.name: Mars
planets.information: Mars is the fourth planet from the Sun and is often called the 'Red Planet' due to its reddish appearance. It has polar ice caps and a thin atmosphere.

planets.name: Jupiter
planets.information: Jupiter is the largest planet in our Solar System, known for its distinct bands of clouds and the Great Red Spot, a persistent storm system.

planets.name: Saturn
planets.information: Saturn is the sixth planet from the Sun and is recognized for its iconic ring system, composed of icy particles and rock debris.

planets.name: Uranus
planets.information: Uranus is the seventh planet from the Sun and is characterized by its unique tilted axis, causing it to rotate on its side.

planets.name: Neptune
planets.information: Neptune is the eighth and farthest known planet from the Sun. It is a gas giant and has a deep blue color due to the presence of methane in its atmosphere.
